text:
A Tense Encounter

Dimly lit room, Raskolnikov anxious, Porfiry relaxed  
The air thick with unspoken tension  
Raskolnikov: “Perhaps this will mean the end?”  

Porfiry: “You didn’t expect a visitor, did you?”  
Raskolnikov: “Sit down, Porfiry Petrovitch, please.”  

---  

Close-up on Raskolnikov's face, fear masked by calm  
His heart races, a storm within  
Raskolnikov: “Speak, speak! Why don’t you speak?”

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov experiences a mix of anticipation and dread as he confronts Porfiry, who unexpectedly visits him.
